item.text: Beneficiary's ability to make changes in body position, or presence of pressure ulcer/injury on the trunk or pelvis?

valueCoding.display: Criteria 1: Completely immobile, cannot makes changes without assistance.

Criteria 2: Limited mobility, cannot make changes significant enough to alleviate pressure without assistance.  Provider Note: The medical record must document the severity of the condition sufficiently to demonstrate the medical necessity for a PRSS.

Criteria 3: Any stage pressure ulcer/injury on the trunk or pelvis. Provider Note: The medical record must document the severity of the condition sufficiently to demonstrate the medical necessity for a PRSS.

item.text: The beneficiary meets one of the three criteria for a Group 2 PRSS. Select one

valueCoding.display: Criteria 1: Multiple stage 2 pressure ulcers located on the trunk or pelvis, which have failed to improve over the past month.
Criteria 2: Has a large stage 3 or 4 pressure ulcer/injury on the trunk or pelvis.
Criteria 2: Has multiple stage 3 or 4 pressure ulcer(s)/injury(s) on the trunk or pelvis.

Criteria 3: Had a myocutaneous flap for a pressure ulcer/injury on the trunk or pelvis within the past 60 days. Criteria 3 pre-req: The beneficiary has been on a group 2 or 3 support surface immediately prior to discharge from a hospital or nursing facility within the past 30 days

Criteria 3: Had a skin graft for a pressure ulcer/injury on the trunk or pelvis within the past 60 days. Criteria 3 pre-req: The beneficiary has been on a group 2 or 3 support surface immediately prior to discharge from a hospital or nursing facility within the past 30 days

answerCoding.display: Criteria 2: Has a large stage 3 or 4 pressure ulcer/injury on the trunk or pelvis.
